page.title: 15LOCAL HISTORY 1
page.content: The Boyden Gate and Highstead areas are rich in traces of pre-history,and local people keep a look out for them {Palaeolithic}remains have often been found by workers in the local gravel pits.The finds are worked flints used by early man and the bones of long extinct animals such as{Mammoths}who lived here before the last Ice Age. Relics of later period are also found. Men ploughing and working on drainage ditches in the valleys often see {Roman}and Medieval pottery brought to the surface by their machines.A number of local people have small collections of ancient coins that they have found digging their gardens and small holdings.The{Monks}had Vineyards here before the Reformation. But no trace of them remains. From the air signs of the 40 salt pans mentioned in Domesday Book can still be seen.
